com.stoyanr.mastermind

Class AlgorithmEvaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stoyanr.mastermind.AlgorithmEvaluator

  • public class AlgorithmEvaluator
extends Object
    An evaluator of the effectiveness of the different strategies. It is initialized with a Mastermind instance (game setup), and an AlgorithmFactory. To perform an evaluation, call the evaluate() method of the evaluator. The remaining methods of this class should be invoked only after the evaluation is complete to determine the various statistics produced by the evaluation, among them the average rounds played which is the main characteristic used to measure the strategy effectiveness. An evaluation can be performed only once.

    Performing an evaluation requires playing all possible games for a given game setup. This is computationally hard and can take a lot of time, especially for larger alphabets and combination lengths. To alleviate this issue, an instance of the GuessCalculator class is created upon construction and used during the evaluation.

    Author:
    Stoyan Rachev

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void evaluate()
      Evaluates the strategy effectiveness.
      double getAverageRoundsPlayed()
      Returns the average number of rounds played during the evaluation, which is the total number of rounds played in all games divided by the number of played games.
      int getGamesPlayed()
      Returns the number of games played during the evaluation.
      int getGamesWon()
      Returns the number of games won during the evaluation.
      int getMaxRoundsPlayed()
      Returns the max number of rounds played in any of the games during the evaluation.
      int getTotalRoundsPlayed()
      Returns the total number of rounds played in all games during the evaluation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlgorithmEvaluator

        public AlgorithmEvaluator(Mastermind mastermind,
                  AlgorithmFactory factory,
                  int levels)
        Creates a new evaluator for the specified setup and algorithm.
        Parameters:
        mastermind - The game setup to use.
        factory - The algorithm factory used to produce multiple instances of the algorithm being evaluated.
        levels - The number of levels passed to the GuessCalculator constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public final void evaluate()
        Evaluates the strategy effectiveness. This method delegates to Mastermind.visitCodes(CodeVisitor) by passing a special visitor which plays a game for each visited code. Finally, it prints the evaluation statistics.

      • getTotalRoundsPlayed

        public final int getTotalRoundsPlayed()
        Returns the total number of rounds played in all games during the evaluation. Should only be called after the evaluation is complete, i.e. the evaluate() method has finished.
        Returns:
        The total number of rounds played in all games during the evaluation.

      • getMaxRoundsPlayed

        public final int getMaxRoundsPlayed()
        Returns the max number of rounds played in any of the games during the evaluation. Should only be called after the evaluation is complete, i.e. the evaluate() method has finished.
        Returns:
        The max number of rounds played in any of the games during the evaluation.

      • getGamesPlayed

        public final int getGamesPlayed()
        Returns the number of games played during the evaluation. Should only be called after the evaluation is complete, i.e. the evaluate() method has finished.
        Returns:
        The number of games played during the evaluation.

      • getGamesWon

        public final int getGamesWon()
        Returns the number of games won during the evaluation. Should only be called after the evaluation is complete, i.e. the evaluate() method has finished.
        Returns:
        The number of games won during the evaluation.

      • getAverageRoundsPlayed

        public final double getAverageRoundsPlayed()
        Returns the average number of rounds played during the evaluation, which is the total number of rounds played in all games divided by the number of played games. Should only be called after the evaluation is complete, i.e. the evaluate() method has finished.
        Returns:
        The average number of rounds played during the evaluation.
